properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 4:15AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
An area of light rain was drifting northeast across the region
early today. Surface temperatures measured several feet above
ground are hovering between 32 and 34 degrees, but road surface
sensors indicate temperatures slightly below freezing in some
locations, which could lead to a light glazing of freezing rain on
untreated surfaces.

Use caution if you plan to travel and be aware that roads that
appear to be wet could in fact be coating with a thin layer of
ice, creating hazardous driving conditions. Slow down and allow
extra time for your morning commute.

NWSheadline: Pockets of light freezing rain and icy roads possible early today
